<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 308, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 378, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 71, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 71, 626, 88]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has fourth term 15 and eighth term 25.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 102, 416, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the 30th term of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 420, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the exact solution of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 92, 685, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\cos \frac{1}{6}\pi +\tan 2x + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} = 0\mathrm{~for~} - \frac{1}{4}\pi < x< \frac{1}{4}\pi . \quad [2]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 74, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficients of \(x^{3}\) and \(x^{4}\) in the expansion of \((3 - ax)^{5}\), where \(a\) is a constant. Give your answers in terms of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 456, 186, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 456, 920, 490]]<|/det|>
Given that the coefficient of \(x^{4}\) in the expansion of \((ax + 7)(3 - ax)^{5}\) is 240, find the positive value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 472, 920, 490]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 69, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[133, 87, 865, 306]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 322, 918, 357]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, the graph with equation \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) is shown with solid lines and the graph with equation \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) is shown with broken lines.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 368, 146, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 918, 403]]<|/det|>
Describe fully a sequence of three transformations which transforms the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) to the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 384, 918, 403]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 662, 146, 681]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 662, 784, 682]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}(x)\) in the form \(a\mathrm{f}(bx + c)\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 662, 917, 681]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
The first term of a convergent geometric progression is 10. The sum of the first 4 terms of the progression is \(p\) and the sum of the first 8 terms of the progression is \(q\). It is given that \(\frac{q}{p} = \frac{17}{16}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 123, 515, 141]]<|/det|>
Find the two possible values of the sum to infinity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 81, 670, 361]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 920, 426]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a metal plate \(ABCDEF\) consisting of five parts. The parts \(BCD\) and \(DEF\) are semicircles. The part \(BAFO\) is a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(20\mathrm{cm}\), and \(D\) lies on this circle. The parts \(OBD\) and \(ODF\) are triangles. Angles \(BOD\) and \(DOF\) are both \(\theta\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 437, 144, 455]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 435, 920, 472]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\theta = 1.2\), find the area of the metal plate. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 452, 920, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 333, 149, 351]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 333, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
Given instead that the area of each semicircle is \(50\pi \mathrm{cm}^2\), find the exact perimeter of the metal plate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 351, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 143, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 860, 94]]<|/det|>
Express \(3x^{2} - 12x + 14\) in the form \(3(x + a)^{2} + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 917, 128]]<|/det|>
<form>

<form>

<form>

<form>

<form> 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 322, 727, 344]]<|/det|>
The function \(\mathrm{f(x) = 3x^{2} - 12x + 14}\) is defined for \(x \geqslant k\) , where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 355, 144, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 355, 609, 374]]<|/det|>
Find the least value of \(k\) for which the function \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 355, 920, 374]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 477, 781, 500]]<|/det|>
For the rest of this question, you should assume that \(k\) has the value found in part **(b)**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 509, 143, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 509, 395, 528]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 509, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 242, 146, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 240, 551, 259]]<|/det|>
Hence or otherwise solve the equation \(\operatorname {ff}(x) = 29\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 241, 920, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 443, 660, 462]]<|/det|>
